Class FloorplanTest

generation.FloorplanTest

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      We create a default (width x height) floorplan object that is not initialized and a (1x1) floorplan1 object.

    • testFloorplan

      public final void testFloorplan()
      Test case: See if constructor used in setUp delivers anything

      Method under test: own set up

      It is correct if the floorplan field is not null.

    • testFloorplanConstructorWithArray

      public final void testFloorplanConstructorWithArray()
      Test case: Check if constructor that takes existing array really copies values and resets values with the initialize method.

      Method under test: Floorplan(int[][] input), getValueOfCell(int i, int j)

      Correct behavior: constructor delivers a floorplan object where all internal positions are set as given. After initialization those values must be set differently.

    • testFloorplanBothConstructors

      public final void testFloorplanBothConstructors()
      Test case: See if the two constructor methods work in a consistent manner

      Method under test: Floorplan(int[][] input), Floorplan(width,height), equals(Object other)

      Correct behavior: It is correct if each constructor delivers a floorplan object and that both are equal if of same dimension and of same content

    • testCanTearDown

      public final void testCanTearDown()
      Test case: Correctness of the canTearDown method

      Method under test: canTearDown(int x, int y, CardinalDirection dir)

      Correct behavior: checks if adjacent cells, (x,y) and its neighbor (x+dx,y+dy), are not separated by a border and (x+dx,y+dy) has not been visited before.

    • testExitPosition

      public final void testExitPosition()
      Test case: Correctness of methods for exit position

      Method under test: setExitPosition(int x, int y) and isExitPosition(int x, int y, int bit)

      Correct behavior: it sets a given bit to zero in a given cell

    • testSetCellAsVisitedToZero

      public final void testSetCellAsVisitedToZero()
      Test case: Correctness of the setCellAsVisited method

      Method under test: setCellAsVisited(int x, int y)

      Correct behavior: Method sets visited flag to zero for a given cell.

    • testSetInRoomToOne

      public final void testSetInRoomToOne()
      Test case: Correctness of the setInRoomToOne method

      Method under test: setInRoomToOne(int x, int y)

      Correct behavior: it sets the InRoom bit to one for a given cell and direction

    • testInitialize

      public final void testInitialize()
      Test case: Correctness of the initialize method

      Method under test: initialize()

      Correct behavior: Initialize maze such that all cells have not been visited (CW_VISITED), all wallboards are up (CW_ALL), and borders are set as a rectangle (CW_*_BOUND).

    • testAreaOverlapsWithRoom

      public final void testAreaOverlapsWithRoom()
      Test case: Correctness of the areaOverlapsWithRoom method

      Method under test: areaOverlapsWithRoom(int rx, int ry, int rxl, int ryl)

      Correct behavior: Checks if there is a cell in the given area that belongs to a room. The first corner is at the upper left position, the second corner is at the lower right position.

    • testAddAndDeleteWall

      public final void testAddAndDeleteWall()
      Test case: Correctness of the addWall, deleteWall methods

      Method under test: deleteWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection cd) Method under test: addWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection cd)

      Correct behavior: it deletes a wallboard between to adjacent cells (x,y) and (x+dx,y+dy).

    • testMarkAreaAsRoom

      public final void testMarkAreaAsRoom()
      Test case: Correctness of the markAreaAsRoom method

      Method under test: markAreaAsRoom(int rw, int rh, int rx, int ry, int rxl, int ryl, Random r) Method under test: isInRoom(int x, int y)

      Correct behavior: it marks a given area as a room on the maze and positions up to five doors randomly. The first corner is at the upper left position, the second corner is at the lower right position. Assumes that given area is located on the map and does not intersect with any existing room. The wallboards of a room are declared as borders to prevent the generation mechanism from tearing them down. rw is the room width, rh is the room height, rx is 1st corner, x coordinate, ry is 1st corner, y coordinate, rxl is 2nd corner, x coordinate, ryl is 2nd corner, y coordinate

    • testHasMaskedBitsTrue

      public final void testHasMaskedBitsTrue()
      Test case: Correctness of the hasMaskedBitsTrue method

      Method under test: hasMaskedBitsTrue(int x, int y, int bitmask)

      Correct behavior: it gets methods (is..., has...) for various flags

    • testIsInRoom

      public final void testIsInRoom()
      Test case: Correctness of the isInRoom method

      Method under test: isInRoom(int x, int y)

      Correct behavior: it tells if InRoom flag is set for given cell

    • testHasWall

      public final void testHasWall()
      Test case: Correctness of the hasWall, hasNoWall methods

      Method under test: hasWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection d) Method under test: hasNoWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection)

      Correct behavior: it tells if cell has a wallboard in the given direction

    • testHasMaskedBitsFalse

      public final void testHasMaskedBitsFalse()
      Test case: Correctness of the hasMaskedBitsFalse method

      Method under test: hasMaskedBitsFalse(int x, int y,int bitmask)

      Correct behavior: it tells if masked bit is false

    • testToString

      public final void testToString()
      Test case: Correctness of the toString method

      Method under test: toString()

      Correct behavior: it dumps internal data into a string, intended usage is for debugging purposes. Maze is represent as a matrix of integer values.

      public void testGetCWConstantForDirection()
      Test method for generation.CardinalDirection#getCWConstantForDirection().
